intro: Caladenia plicata, commonly known as the Narrow-leafed Spider-orchid, is a striking member of the orchid family native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and its distinctive, spider-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces a single, narrow leaf and relies on specific mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake, which is common among orchids. Caladenia plicata thrives in sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Its blooming period occurs during the autumn months, adding a vibrant touch to the landscape.
